title: Damian De Allende has had his inner mongrel reinstalled by Rassie Erasmus - he is the man England should fear
text:
The debate that has raged this week over whether to stick with George Ford at fly-half for Saturday’s World Cup final, or move captain Owen Farrell to 10 and bring Henry Slade back into the midfield, can be traced largely to the form of one man.

Damian de Allende, South Africa’s swarthy inside centre, has been brilliant in this World Cup. An imposing figure in the Boks backline, at 6ft2in and nearly 16 stone, his presence has been central to Eddie Jones' thinking. After all, the decision to name Ford among the 'finishers' for the game with Australia was made with the image of Samu Kerevi crashing down his channel in mind.
